questions.question: What does the "net" in the term "netiquette" stand for?
In which situation would the rules of digital etiquette apply?

choices.answer: Standing in a crowded computer store.
Giving a birthday card to your cousin.

questions.question: You should use digital etiquette if you're writing on:
Which of the following children is most likely to practice good digital etiquette?

choices.answer: Never covers their mouth when coughing.
Laughs at classmate for saying wrong answer.

questions.question: Why would an anonymous person feel bold enough to say mean things on a message board?

choices.answer: Other reading the mean post will think better of them.
They think no one can do anything about the bullying.
Older, smarter people will be impressed.
Both happen only on the Internet.
Both happen only at sporting events.
Both are hurtful and insulting to others.

questions.question: Which is the best way to text your mom to tell her you'll be an hour late?

choices.answer: I'll be home in an hour. See you later!
I'm running late. Be there in an hour.

questions.question: Which statement about communicating on the Internet is correct?

choices.answer: It can be hard to understand humor by text.
Your identity can never be discovered online.

questions.question: Which emotion is most likely to trigger a flamewar?
You took a picture of a friend. What is the best mindset about posting the picture online?

choices.answer: It's your photo - do whatever you want.
Info about your friends, including pics, is private.
It is illegal to post pictures, don't do it.
You should never post images on the Internet.
